dct_description_sm: First printed atlas of Italy, published posthumously by Magini's son Fabio.
Latitudinal and longitudinal lines along margins of maps.
First 2 and last 2 pages blank (included in page description).
Engraved title page with woodcut border ("Oliverius Gattus inu & fe."), head and tail-piecies throughout.
"Cum privilegio" on title page; dedications on maps.
Descriptive text on some maps, in secondary cartouches.
Decorative banners and cartouches (including cherubs, flora and fauna), bar scales, compass roses.
Maps show topography, vegetation (including crops, e.g. Map 59), waterways, ports.
Illustrations of cities, ships, sea monsters.
Map 48 has coats of arms, mythical figures.
dct_rights_sm: Images from the The Renaissance Exploration Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
